org.jamsim.ascape.r
Class ScapeRInterface

java.lang.Object
  org.jamsim.ascape.r.ScapeRInterface

public class ScapeRInterface
extends Object

Exposes scape specific R functionality for a particular scape, as well as general R functionality.

Version:
$Revision$
Author:
Oliver Mannion

DEFAULT_DF_SYMBOL

public static final String DEFAULT_DF_SYMBOL
Default dataframe replacement symbol to use if none specified in constructor.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

ScapeRInterface

public ScapeRInterface(RLoader rLoader,
                       MicroSimScape<?> msScape,
                       String dataFrameSymbol,
                       boolean keepAllRunDFs)
Constructor.

Parameters:
rLoader - R loader
msScape - micro simulation scape
dataFrameSymbol - replacement symbol. When evaluating commands that reference the scape dataframe, this symbol is searched for and replaced with the current run's dataframe name.
keepAllRunDFs - flag to keep the dataframes from each run in R. This means creating each new dataframe with a unique name.
Method Detail

getLastMsScapeNode

public static MicroSimScapeNode getLastMsScapeNode()
Get the last (i.e: most recently created) ScapeRInterface's MicroSimScape's MicroSimScapeNode. This is exposed statically so it can be accessed from AscapeGD and R code to add navigator nodes from R.

Returns:
the most recently created MicroSimScape.

getMsScape

public MicroSimScape<?> getMsScape()
Get the scape. For AscapeGD.

Returns:
micro simulation scape

loadRFile

public void loadRFile(File file)
               throws IOException
Evaluate the contents of a file in R with a "loading" message printed to the console. The file is evaluated relative to the folder it is in.

Parameters:
file - file containing R commands
Throws:
IOException - if problem reading or evaluating file

assignScapeDataFrame

public void assignScapeDataFrame(int runNumber)
                          throws RFaceException
Create a dataframe from the scape. If the scape has no members, silently does nothing.

Parameters:
runNumber - run number. Used in the naming of the dataframe
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem during creation

baseFileUpdated

public void baseFileUpdated()
Execute the base file update command. Call this when you have changed variables and after writing the scape to a dataframe.

Parameters:

Returns:

assignDataFrame

public void assignDataFrame(String name,
                            Collection<? extends CMarkedUpRowBean> col,
                            Class<?> stopClass)
                     throws RFaceException
Create a dataframe in R from the given collection. Introspection is used to determine the bean properties (i.e.: getter methods) that are exposed, and each one becomes a column in the dataframe. Columns are only created for primitive properties and arrays of primitive properties; object properties are ignored without warning. NB: doesn't automatically create factors like read.table does.

Parameters:
name - the name of the dataframe to create in R.
col - the Java collection to convert.
stopClass - Columns are created for all getter methods that are defined by stopClass's subclasses. stopClass's getter methods and superclass getter methods are not converted to columns in the dataframe.
Throws:
RFaceException - if Collection cannot be read, or dataframe cannot be created.

assignDataFrame

public void assignDataFrame(String name,
                            CDataCacheContainer container)
                     throws RFaceException
Create a dataframe in R from the given casper dataset. NB: doesn't automatically create factors like read.table does.

Parameters:
name - the name of the dataframe to create in R.
container - the casper container to convert.
Throws:
RFaceException - if Collection cannot be read, or dataframe cannot be created.

assignMatrix

public void assignMatrix(String name,
                         CDataCacheContainer container)
                  throws RFaceException
Create a matrix in R from the given casper dataset. All elements of the casper dataset must be of the same type.

Parameters:
name - the name of the dataframe to create in R.
container - the casper container to convert.
Throws:
RFaceException - if Collection cannot be read, or the matrix cannot be created.

eval

public REXP eval(String expr)
          throws RFaceException
Evaluate a String expression in R in the global environment. See RFace.eval(String).

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate.
Returns:
REXP result of the evaluation.
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem during parse or evaluation. Parse errors will simply return the message "parse error".

parseEvalPrint

public REXP parseEvalPrint(String expr)
Evaluate an expression printing to the console any errors (including syntactic) and the expression if it is visible. See RFace.parseEvalPrint(String).

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate
Returns:
evaluated result

parseEvalPrintLogReplace

public REXP parseEvalPrintLogReplace(String rCommand,
                                     int runNumber)
Run rcmdReplace(String, int) on the rCommand then parseEvalPrint(String). Output to log when execution has finished.

Parameters:
rCommand - R command
runNumber - run number
Returns:
evaluated result

parseEvalTry

public REXP parseEvalTry(String expr)
                  throws RFaceException
Wraps a parse and try around an eval. The parse will generate syntax error messages, and the try will catch parse and evaluation errors and return them in the exception as opposed to printing it on the console.

Parameters:
expr - expression to try and parse and eval
Returns:
REXP result of the evaluation.
Throws:
RFaceException - if there is a parse or evaluation error the error message is returned in the exception. Nothing printed to the console.

parseEvalTryReturnRMatrix

public RMatrix parseEvalTryReturnRMatrix(String expr)
                                  throws RFaceException
Calls RFace.parseEvalTryReturnRMatrix(String).

Parameters:
expr - expression
Returns:
RMatrix
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem evaluating expr, including if expr does not return an expression that can be represented as a RMatrix.

parseEvalTryReturnNamedNumber

public org.omancode.math.NamedNumber[] parseEvalTryReturnNamedNumber(String expr)
                                                              throws RFaceException
Evaluates expr and returns an array of NamedNumber.

Parameters:
expr - expression
Returns:
named number array
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem evaluating expr, including if expr does not return a REXPDouble or REXPInteger.

help

public void help(String expr)
Display R help for given expression.

Parameters:
expr - expression. If "" displays help contents

public void linefeed()
Print linefeed to console.

printPrompt

public final void printPrompt()
Print the prompt to the console.

evalCaptureOutput

public String evalCaptureOutput(String expr)
                         throws RFaceException
Evaluate a String expression in R in the global environment. Returns all console output produced by this evaluation. Does not return the REXP produced by the evaluation. This is needed for functions like str which print their output and don't return anything.

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate.
Returns:
console output from the evaluation.
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem during parse or evaluation. Parse errors will simply return the message "parse error".

evalReturnStrings

public String[] evalReturnStrings(String expr)
Evaluate expression returning a String array. See RFace.evalReturnStrings(String).

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate.
Returns:
REXP result of the evaluation.

evalReturnString

public String evalReturnString(String expr)
Evaluate expression that returns a character vector. Returns the character vector as a String. See RFace.evalReturnString(String).

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate.
Returns:
REXP result of the evaluation.

printToConsole

public void printToConsole(String msg)
Print a message out to the R console (no line feed).

Parameters:
msg - message to print.

printlnToConsole

public void printlnToConsole(String msg)
Print a message out to the R console with a line feed.

Parameters:
msg - message to print.

loadPackage

public final void loadPackage(String pack)
                       throws RFaceException
Loads a package. If it isn't installed, it is loaded from CRAN.

Parameters:
pack - package name
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem loading package.

meanOfRuns

public CDataCacheContainer meanOfRuns(CDataCacheContainer allRuns,
                                      String dfName,
                                      String dfDesc)
                               throws RFaceException
Execute the r command "meanOfRuns" on the supplied dataset. First saves the dataset as a dataframe called dfName then executes "meanOfRuns".

Parameters:
allRuns - dataset from all runs. The first variable is the row name and subsequent variables are run values for each row, eg: Category Run 1 Run 2 1 0.0039392527 4.189704e-03 2 0.0052892006 5.554406e-03 3 0.0500477200 4.921984e-02 4 0.0061327012 6.273054e-03
dfName - dataframe name to create
dfDesc - dataframe description
Returns:
the original dataset plus the additional variables: Mean, Err, Left, Right
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem creating dataframe or executing R command

updateScenarioWeights

public void updateScenarioWeights(String basefileName,
                                  String factorName,
                                  double[] props)
                           throws RFaceException
Calls updateScenarioWeights in R. Updates the "weightScenario" variable in the basefile based on the desired proportions (props) for factor factorName.

Parameters:
basefileName - name of base file
factorName - name of factor variable
props - proportions
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem calling.

createRObjectTreeBuilder

public RObjectTreeBuilder createRObjectTreeBuilder(String[] includeClasses)
                                            throws RFaceException
Creates a new R object tree builder with the set of R objects present in the global environment at time of creation.

Parameters:
includeClasses - specify the classes of object to display, or null to display objects of any class.
Returns:
R object tree builder.
Throws:
RFaceException - if problem during interrogation of R environment
